title: The Essential Guide to Self-Sufficiency: Cultivating Your Survival Garden"**

tasks.task: Gardening and harvesting green leafy vegetables
subtasks: Identifying and selecting mature leaves for harvesting
Using scissors or shears to cut leaves at the base
Removing yellow or damaged leaves to encourage new growth
Leaving a few leaves on the plant to promote regrowth
Ensuring proper pruning to maintain plant health and continuous harvest
Cleaning harvested leaves with vinegar solution to prevent contamination
Storing harvested leaves (e.g., freezing) for future use

tasks.task: First, I think the main task here is gardening, specifically maintaining and harvesting leafy greens. So the MAINTASK should be "Gardening and harvesting green leafy vegetables." Then, to break that down into subtasks, I have to think about what the person is actually doing in the video.
Gardening and harvesting green leafy vegetables
MAINTASK: Gardening and maintaining green leafy vegetable plants
subtasks: Using shears to clip leaves at the base of the plant, ensuring a clean cut
Inspecting leaves for signs of yellowing or damage, removing these to prevent disease spread
Leaving residual leaves (3-4) on each plant to stimulate regrowth and maintain plant health
Regularly pruning the plants to promote new growth and continuous harvesting
Cleaning harvested leaves with a vinegar solution (1 capful per gallon of water) to eliminate bacteria and pests
Storing excess harvested leaves (e.g., freezing kale) for later use to extend the growing season
